Passages.text:
Παλλάδʼ Ἀθηναίην ἐρυσίπτολιν ἄρχομʼ ἀείδειν,
δεινήν, ᾗ σὺν Ἄρηι μέλει πολεμήια ἔργα
περθόμεναί τε πόληες ἀϋτή τε πτόλεμοί τε,
καί τʼ ἐρρύσατο λαὸν ἰόντα τε νισσόμενόν τε.
χαῖρε, θεά, δὸς δʼ ἄμμι τύχην εὐδαιμονίην τε.
Passages.author: Unknown

Passages.text:
Ξέρξου δὲ γράψαντος αὐτῷ, ἔξεστί σοι μὴ θεομαχοῦντι, μετʼ ἐμοῦ δὲ ταττομένῳ, τῆς Ἑλλάδος μοναρχεῖν, ἀντέγραψεν, εἰ τὰ καλὰ τοῦ βίου ἐγίγωσκες, ἀπέστης ἂν τῆς τῶν ἀλλοτρίων ἐπιθυμίας ἐμοὶ δὲ κρείττων ὁ ὑπὲρ τῆς Ἑλλάδος θάνατος τοῦ μοναρχεῖν τῶν ὁμοφύλων.

πάλιν δὲ τοῦ Ξέρξου γράψαντος, πέμψον

τὰ ὅπλα, ἀντέγραψε, μολὼν λαβέ.
Passages.author: Plutarch

Passages.text:
"O socii—neque enim ignari sumus ante malorum—
O passi graviora, dabit deus his quoque finem.
Vos et Scyllaeam rabiem penitusque sonantis
accestis scopulos, vos et Cyclopea saxa
experti: revocate animos, maestumque timorem
mittite: forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvabit.
Passages.author: Virgil

Passages.text:
[ΚΡΕΩΝ] πορθῶν δὲ τήνδε γῆν: ὁ δ᾽ ἀντιστὰς ὕπερ.
[ΑΝΤΙΓΟΝΗ] ὁμῶς ὅ γ᾽ Ἅιδης τοὺς νόμους τούτους ποθεῖ.
[ΚΡΕΩΝ] ἀλλ᾽ οὐχ ὁ χρηστὸς τῷ κακῷ λαχεῖν ἴσος.
[ΑΝΤΙΓΟΝΗ] τίς οἶδεν εἰ κάτωθεν εὐαγῆ τάδε;
[ΚΡΕΩΝ] οὔτοι ποθ᾽ οὑχθρός, οὐδ᾽ ὅταν θάνῃ, φίλος.
[ΑΝΤΙΓΟΝΗ] οὔτοι συνέχθειν, ἀλλὰ συμφιλεῖν ἔφυν.
Passages.author: Sophocles

Physicists.name: Albert Einstein
Physicists.desc: Known for his theories of relativity, discovery of the photoelectric effect, and contributions to quantum mechanics.

Physicists.name: Stephen Hawking
Physicists.desc: Known for his study on cosmology and black holes, especially his discovery that black holes emit radiation (now known as Hawking radiation).

Physicists.name: Erwin Schrödinger
Physicists.desc: Known for his many contributions to quantum theory, including the Schrödinger equation, quantum entanglement, and of course, the half-dead cat.

Physicists.name: James Clark Maxwell
Physicists.desc: Known for his work on electromagnetics, Maxwell's equations, and the Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution.

Physicists.name: Paul Dirac
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the founders of quantum mechanics, his work on quantum electrodynamics, and the Dirac equation.

Physicists.name: Niels Bohr
Physicists.desc: Known for the Bohr model of the atoms, and as one of the founders of quantum theory. Worked to promote international scientific research.

Physicists.name: Isaac Newton
Physicists.desc: Known for establishing classical mechanics, his work on optics, and formulation of calculus.

Physicists.name: J. Robert Oppenheimer
Physicists.desc: Known for his contributions to quantum mechanics and nuclear physics. Oversaw the Manhattan Project as its director, though later he strongly opposed nuclear proliferation.

Physicists.name: Richard Feynman
Physicists.desc: Known for his work in quantum electrodynamics and particle physics. Developed Feynman diagrams to describe the behavior of subatomic particles.

Physicists.name: Max Planck
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the founders of quantum theory. Discovered that energy is quantized, and postulated the Planck constant.

Physicists.name: Max Born
Physicists.desc: Helped create the matrix mechanics representation, and formulated the standard interpretation of the probability density function in the Schrödinger equation.

Physicists.name: Werner Heisenberg
Physicists.desc: Known as one of the pioneers of quantum theory. Developed the matrix formulation of quantum mechanics with M. Born and P. Jordan. Discovered the uncertainty principle.

Physicists.name: Marie Curie
Physicists.desc: Pioneered the theory of radioactivity, and discovered the elements polonium and radium. First woman to win the Nobel prize and first person to win the Nobel prize twice.

Physicists.name: Hendrik Lorentz
Physicists.desc: Provided a theoretical explanation of the Zeeman effect. Derived the Lorentz transformation of the special theory of relativity, as well as the Lorentz force.

Physicists.name: Wolfgang Pauli
Physicists.desc: One of the pioneers of quantum physics. Discovered the Pauli exclusion principle, for which he received a Nobel prize in 1945.
